result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew R Kilgore Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay all appropriate costs. Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered. Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC'sfrom 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming.
- Cognitive intervention programming.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
- No Contact with the victim, L.M.(s) without prior court/agent approval. Any violation may result in additional charges.
- Obtain/maintain employment and/or school and/or vocation training.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew R Kilgore Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed, Filed, and Distributed; Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.195 is DENIED because it is not in the public interest.  Written reasons included in signed order of the Court.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, calendar successor, for review. mag
Original SENTENCING Transcript (19 pages) commencing SEPTEMBER 3, 2015 received and filed. kl

Defendant Andrew R Kilgore in court with attorney Matthew E. Weil.  Defendant Andrew R Kilgore in custody.  Porchia Sharese Lewand for Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

CASE HEARD BY BRANCH 6 FOR BRANCH 40.

AMENDED COUNT 1 - CONSECUTIVE:
Statements made as to sentencing.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 30 MONTHS; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 12 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* No contact with the victim, L.M.(s) without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for sentencing.   Case is adjourned in branch 40.

Defendant Andrew R Kilgore in court with attorney Matthew E. Weil.  Defendant Andrew R Kilgore in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a final pre-trial. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered penalty enhancer, domestic abuse repeater dismissed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for 08-20-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew R Kilgore in court with attorney Matthew E. Weil.  Defendant Andrew R Kilgore in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final pre-trial held with the parties.  Case remains scheduled for trial in Branch 40.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for further final pre-trial.  Court orders case adjourned for further final pre-trial in Branch 40.
Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set including the No Contact Order.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Defendant Andrew R Kilgore in court with attorney Matthew E. Weil.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Andrew R Kilgore in court with attorney .  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
JUDGE BOROWSKI FOR JUDGE DALLETT.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #13CF1936 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Brian Pinter.  Exhibit #1 received.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Exhibit #1 withdrawn.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lantonya M

Defendant Andrew R Kilgore in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Andrew R Kilgore in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Andrew R Kilgore Jr

Prior: 4977 North 84th Street #2, Milwaukee, WI 53225
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
